definition: to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
meritorious deed or service/achievement/result/service/accomplishment/work (physics)
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: It must be found, or else all this work is meaningless.
sentences.chinese: 必須找到它，不然會前功盡棄。

sentences.english: Now if I cut it, all my previous work will be wasted.
sentences.chinese: 如果我現在把它剪斷，就等於前功盡棄。

sentences.english: On the first Vanadiel day you attempt to feed the chocobo and he does not take.
sentences.chinese: 期間我要是餵過他會不會前功盡棄？

sentences.english: And if a single word were to come from your mouth, all your work would be lost.
sentences.chinese: 只要你嘴裏漏出一個字，一切努力就前功盡棄啦。

definition: the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
to correct an error
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to force someone to do something
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to no avail/of no use
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
to play deaf-mute
to be stuck/to feel stuck
to prevail upon/to coax
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
